description: For centuries the pact with the devil has signified humankind's desire to surpass the limits of human knowledge and power. From the reformation chap book to the rock lyrics of Randy Newman's Faust, from Marlowe and Goethe to key Hollywood films, the legend of the devil's pact continues to be useful for exploring our fascination with forbidden powers.
name: The Devil's Pact in Literature, Music and Film

section.name: The Devil's Pact in Literature, Music and Film

values.comments:
For centuries, the pact with the devil has signified humankind\'s desire to surpass the limits of human knowledge and power. From the reformation chapbook to the rock lyrics of Randy Newman\'s Faust, from Marlowe and Goethe to key Hollywood films, the legend of the devil\'s pact continues to be useful for exploring our fascination with forbidden powers.
Students were pleased with the quality of this course for it “definitely encourages you to think”. The many themes of the course made it very interesting, and the assigned readings and movie screenings added great value to the overall academic experience. Students learned much from this course and were very excited about the assignments.
Professor Richter received high praise from his students. He was able to successfully communicate the material and students felt that the professor “effectively blended all of these topics together while never once wasting (our) time or losing (our) interest.” Professor Richter kept students stimulated in the rich lecture material and was very willing to discuss course content with his students.
A lot of work was required for the course but students were very fond of the assigned books, films, and music. The course was highly recommended for majors yet was also described as “great for a non-humanities student who wants to dabble in literature and film.”
